result.name: claimant-count
result.notes: Previously named Claimant count. Information on the numbers and characteristics of people claiming benefit principally for the reason of being unemployed derived from Jobseeker's Allowance data. Available for various geographic levels down to local authority and parliamentary constituency.

organization.name: office-for-national-statistics
organization.title: Office for National Statistics
organization.description:
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) is the UK’s largest independent producer of official statistics and is the recognised national statistical institute for the UK. It is responsible for collecting and publishing statistics related to the economy, population and society at national, regional and local levels. It also conducts the census in England and Wales every ten years. 

The ONS plays a leading role in national and international good practice in the production of official statistics. It is the executive office of the UK Statistics Authority and although they are separate, they are still closely related.

result.title: Claimant count Nomis dataset

extras.value: The raw data on claimants of Jobseeker's Allowance are obtained from the  Department for Work and Pensions for the specific purpose of calculating the Claimant Count statistical dataset.  A number of aggregate datasets are compiled, which allow users to explore different characteristics of claimants while protecting the personal data in the original microdata.  These published datasets can be accessed through the ONS and Nomis websites.
